The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 31 March is 41,435 (4,795.8 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 26 March, there were 232 new confirmed cases (26.9 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 19 March, there were 282 new cases, and so the new cases have decreased by 18% (50 fewer cases).
